Reviews.Title: “hello”
Reviews.Author: rebecka t
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the hotel with clean rooms, a large variety for breakfast and friendly staff, especially ugur. Great location for all tourist sites!

Reviews.Title: “Very good service!”
Reviews.Author: laurianessenstam
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! good service! Perfect location. it was a pleasure to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ã  good hotel with Ã  good service”
Reviews.Author: Liekeonland
Reviews.Content: We have had a very good time at the hotel. It was very clean and the service was very good. furthermore it is Ã  perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “hello”
Reviews.Author: JantineKip
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with very helpfull and nice personell and good breakfast. Clean rooms with lots of space and good facilites. EverythÄ±ng Ä±s on walkÄ±ng dÄ±stance. I would recommand Ä±t to all my frÄ±ends. JantÄ±ne (ToerÄ±sm student of the Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: dmadcow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the end of March for 7 nights & was very impressed. The hotel is clean with a very varied breakfast. The staff were all very friendly & helpful. It has an excellent location with Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Spice Bazaar, Gulhane Park & Hagia Sophia Museum all within easy walking distance. I had a fabulous time & would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: ddingermany
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd hotel I booked through Trip Advisor that was highly reviewed that, once you arrive, has an "old hotel" and a "newer hotel". We booked a triple and the 1st room was a disgrace (see pics). 2 nights later they moved us to a better room, that was more renovated (bathroom and carpet) but it still wreaked of smoke and the pull out bed was literally broken in 2 - luckily our daughter is 6 and small, otherwise it would have been a probem. Breakfast was just okay (1st day no milk, 2nd day no spoons, 3rd day no cereal, etc) - in walking around the hotel I saw that there were some nice rooms that must have drawn the good reviews but you can't be sure you will get one. BOTTOM LINE: 1. You can do better even if your budget is limited, and 2. When you see reviews of both 1 and 5, stay away = that means the hotel is not uniform in having nice rooms across the entire hotel. ***I gave a 2 instead of a 1 because of the wifi, descent location, and that breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Nejla T
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a group of 18 people for 7 nights in end March-beginning April 2012. The hotel was clean, the breakfast was tasty and rich for a budget hotel, the staff was very friendly and helpfull. The location is its big trump, close to the most of the well known sights of Istanbul like Sultanahmet mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi palace...There are a lot of shops in the street where the hotel is located. I'm planning to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent , cheap stay”
Reviews.Author: Arsenal-Hellas
Reviews.Content: Stayed there back in 2010 for 3 days, very nice stay, cheap accomodation with excellent service, kind front desk, great breakfast, amazing location. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “CONVENIENT and good choice for budget hotel w/ amenities”
Reviews.Author: awlrain
Reviews.Content: If you are just looking for a functional abode and a place to rest your head at night, read on. I was in Istanbul in October 2011 and Hotel Ilkay is right on the main artery where the tram in Sultanahmet runs. As we arrived they sat us for a short info/city orientation session and a cup of famous apple tea in their adjoining restaurant/bar, which was a nice way to get started. The absolute best part Be sure to request a room in the new building. Our room was in the connected old building, which was more rundown, but the room was clean and the place was well run. I remember liking the Turkish linens we slept on -- very smooth. There is also free wifi throughout, which was great bc we relied on it to keep in touch with folks at home, get the weather forecast, etc. The included breakfast spread was pretty good too (sure beats continental breakfasts in the US) -- we really enjoyed it all, and especially the dark tan / brown MOLASSES WITH TAHINI sauce, which we put on everything! The American coffee runs out fast, so be sure to arrive early if you can't stomach the Turkish grinds. When we told reception that we had a 5am departure flight, they did their best to pack us a mini breakfast to-go, which was very helpful. They also helped us arrange a taxi when our original departure plan fell through. Hotel Ilkay was part of a trip package deal, but I am pretty sure the usual price is pretty reasonable. It's the budget hotel within a group, so if you prefer something with more amenities, check out the "Sirkeci Group" links on their website. In generally, we were very happy with the service, especially for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service really!”
Reviews.Author: KalinaMalina
Reviews.Content: Receptionists were very polite, going out of their way to be helpful. The hotel is nothing amazing but modest, convenient, with a great location, clean and comfortable. Many paid parking lots around so your car is not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and more”
Reviews.Author: AndoverBob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June 2011. It is a short walk to the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. It is also on the tram line as the tram runs right down the street - Hudavendigar Cad. Prices are reasonable. This is not a high end place, but very useful when visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dunya511
Reviews.Content: A simple, clean room. Unfortunately the wall between rooms are very thin, so you could have a sleep problem as we did (in the other room were two men who partied all night long). Stuff is very friendly, breakfast is rich and very tasteful. Some elevator problems. A location is excellent. A very nice hotel's taxi driver.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kalcenter Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is something sublime. Besides being a few meters from Topkapi and Hagia Sofia, the street where the hotel is located is full of great (and cheap) options for dinning, and a lot of shops very interesting. The Grand Bazaar is no more than 15 minutes walk. The blue line tram has two equally spaced, no more than 100 meters with easy connection to the AtaturkÂ´s metro line. Staff sublime, always very friendly. The room was large, spacious, clean and super-heated. On my next trip to Istanbul, I will be there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaaner
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the little u pay. The hotel is clean rooms are big enough,its no 5 star hotel but then again your not going to Istanbul to sit around in a hotel when there is so much to do and to see offcourse. Very helpfull staff and a real kind receptionist named Ugur who could inform us about all the things we dident know about Istanbul. We enjouyd our stay hope u do to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and very good location”
Reviews.Author: Hvalsoee
Reviews.Content: Location in the old part af Istanbul, near the blue Mosque. We where there 13/2 until 16/2 in room 502. Room was clean and furniture in a satisfying quality. Little room with bed with a good hard matress - just as we like it ;-) - so we sleept very well. Bathroom was in a good size, and everything worked in the room. Also the safe. Breakfast was ok. Tip: From airport to hotel takes only 45 minutes with metro and speed tram. costs in all 4 lira pr. person.

Reviews.Title: “hotel perfect and the stuff are very freindly”
Reviews.Author: ali h
Reviews.Content: its the second time i visit istanbul and its the second time also that i reserve in sirceci goup hotel chain . ugur the reseption guy is very freindly he is a good guy . and sure each time i vÄ±sÄ±t istanbul i will use seiceci group as my destination to rest. because of the good well and good sevice and the easy access via internet to reserve. thanks

Reviews.Title: “If you don't stay too much in the room, it's ok.”
Reviews.Author: janetutza
Reviews.Content: Very, very small room. The food was not that great, but great location of the hotel, in the center of the city, easy to get to all important places in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “"Exellent location, best price"”
Reviews.Author: sezgin77
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed very much my stay at Hotel Ilkay. The staff was nice and very pleasant and accommodatÄ±ng and service was excellent for a budget hotel! The hotel has very godd location and distance to historical places.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Kate E
Reviews.Content: I first visited Turkey this year. and I and my family stayed at the hotel Ä°lkay. We were in this hotel a week and during that time everything was perfect. each day perfectly clean rooms (folded neatly things are always new clean towels and bed linen. well there is always soap and other shower accessories.) Also in Ä°lkay very delicious breakfast. a Buffet (a variety of dishes, always in the presence of fresh bread and other foods). In the hotel has a bar, "Red River" which is also very comfortable. The location of this hotel is very comfortable. despite the fact that the area quiet, close to the hotel there are many shops and restaurants. I really enjoyed my trip to Turkey, and I am confident that this is also thanks to the hotel. If you will go to Istanbul and ostanovites at this hotel, you will not regret it. thank you to UGUR

Reviews.Title: “A budget hotel blessed with EXCELLENT location!”
Reviews.Author: Betilu
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Ilkay. The staff was wonderfully pleasant and accommodatÄ±ng and service was excellent for a budget hotel! Location: Istanbul is a big city, with serious traffic and distance issues, so location of a hotel is absolutely a priority if you do not want to spend hours in the traffic. Sirkeci, in my opinion, is the most convenient lodging district for sightseers on foot. First, Sirkeci is located between EminÃ¶nÃ¼ and GÃ¼lhane. Much of the old town including the Sultanahmet area and even Galata in southern new town can be reached on foot. Also, the T1 Tram line runs through the area, which provides easy access to the new town. Ilkay Hotel is well located in the SÄ±rkeci Distrist and many of the sights are within walking distance from the hotel. It is a clean budget hotel in Sirkeci district. Quoting a previous review: â€œIt fills the budget hotel role among the Sirkeci Group of hotels and restaurants, and offers terrific location, great value, and friendly service to budget-conscious independent travelersâ€�. I completely agree with this. The hotel is near the historical places (Sultanahmet, Aya Sofya, Topkapi Palace, hipodrom etc). It is also near Eminonu where you can take a Bosporus tour or the boat to the Asian side of the city. There is even a colorful adjoined souvenir shop where we did a lot if our present buying! (Last minute purchases!!!) -Transportation the Hotel Istanbul has 2 airports. We arrived to the main one (Ataturk International in the European side) from where we got a free airport pickup (for booking three or more nights). We also got a 7% discount for paying upfront in Euro cash. - Staff/Reception The staff at the front -desk was very friendly, helpful and efficient. They made the bookings for a day-trip and a show. The registration process was quick. Always ready to give us information about places to see and things to do. - Rooms I booked two double rooms. Good size, comfortable beds. Rooms were clean and well maintained, Bathrooms were neat with some amenities â€“ shampoo, liquid soap, hair-dryer. TV with many international channels in English and French, German, Italian and Russian channels. - Breakfast Breakfast was very nice indeed! Fresh and tasty: several types of corn flakes, two type of cheese, fresh vegetables, cream, peanut butter, different sorts of bread, coffee, tea, juice, sausages, fruits, oriental sweets. Really great! Much better than in other hotels I have stayed in Istanbul! - Internet There is an internet station next to the lobby, which worked fine. Free Wi â€“ Fi. - Atmosphere: The best! Family oriented. Special thanks for the hospitality!!! Turkish friendliness & warmness: I love it! A piece of advice: tea/coffee making facilities in the room would be great! Would I stay there again? Absolutely!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Enjoyable Place to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SJZTravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from three nights at this hotel and definitely enjoyed our stay. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and, as others have mentioned, the location is great. The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi, and the National Archeology Museum are within a ten to 15 minute walk to your left as you exit the hotel, and the Spice Bazaar and the waterfront are ten minutes to your right. A tram that runs up and down the street, so if you don't want to walk you can easily get to all of the attractions from the tram stop that is right around the corner from the hotel. We loved Istanbul, and would definitely stay at the Hotel Illkay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Amanda H
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right in between Spice Markets and Grand Bazaar, probably a 10 minute walk to either. Clean room, I stayed in the newer refurbished section, I see there are others complaining about an older section. There was a generator or something that started outside my window and was going most of the night which was annoying but it wasnt so loud I couldnt sleep.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abdisalam
Reviews.Content: I have stayed Ilkay for 4 days and I'm delighted that I had chosen this hotel - wonderful experience and above all the front-desk staff "Sadat & Sugar" were execeptional. Location, location, location -- all the major historic sites were in walking distance from the hotel. Transportation and restauants were all close. Clean, adequate space, good breakfast, friendly staff, you name it -- everything number one. I would recommend to anyone planning to visit Istanbul and if any chance I visit Istanbul again, I will definitely stay Ilkay. Abdisalam

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kurt4600
Reviews.Content: We stay there 13 to 19 October. We have suite (family room) as we had 2 children of 15 and 12 years. We were picked up from Sabiha Gokcen Airport and driven there against some payment (40 euros one way). The hotel is very close to all attractions. The room was big enough for 4 people and was cleaned daily. There was free internet in rooms. Breakfast was actually the same thing everyday, but there were still many variations you can choose from. Receptionist Fatih, Ugur was really nice and helpful, and I thank them warmly for their kindness. We have been very happy with the hotel and recommended for all people. I would definitely choose Ilkay Hotel again next time we travel to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Extreme Failure”
Reviews.Author: voidelt
Reviews.Content: When I decided to go Istanbul, I was in exciment to meet a very fascinating culture and hospitality. But It was a graet shock for me to stay in Ilkay Hotel. Except for Ä±ts being close most of the turistic areas, there is nothing else as advantage in this hotel. You can find better places in that area in which you will feel the real quality. The hotel has two sides I think. One side is modern and the other one is old, dirty and bed smells. In my opinion, the hotel holder is giving all those rooms by choosing the guest like whom to bad part whom to good part. It is jus HUMILIATING!!! The other problem was the breakfast.Yes there was enough kinds but; the service, the sufficiancy of foods and the cleanless of the saloon was awful. One morning I had to wait 10 minutes to take a table and then I sat one on which there were empty and dirty plates, glasses, etc. I stayed in this hotel without any care to me. The hostility was zero. I find a reason and I left the Hotel one day before and I spend my last day in Faros Hotel which was near to Ilkay. I am sure that If I come Istanbul again, I will never ever stay in this failed hotel. I will not suggest Ilkay Hotel to my friends and I will tell them how yhis hotel was a horror and HUMILIATING!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, unbeatable price, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: vas29
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest features of our college re-union trip to istanbul was our stay at Hotel ilkay. The location is superb....we were never more than a 15 minute walk from all the major attractions, the Bosphorus was close at hand and we were surrounded by a multitude of inexpensive cafe's and restaraunts. Hotel services were adequate for a budget hotel. We were in the old wing so no fancy gadgetsen suite but really didnt miss any mod cons. Rooms were clean and well maintained, bathrooms were neat, breakfast was plentiful ( but a bit boring!). We would have liked tea/coffee making facilities in the room...the sleepy trudge down to the basement for our morning cuppa was a little off-putting! I think the reason we liked Ilkay so much was the wonderful friendly staff both on-line and at the hotel. Bercin, in the sales team was patient and accommodating of all our changes prior to the trip and was very helpful in organzing hotel transfers.The staff at the front -desk (Umed in particular and the aptly named Sugar!) were friendly and helpful and always ready to give us information about places to see and things to do. They were flexible in giving us 3 triple rooms ( we asked for 3 doubles!) at no extra cost.... Would I stay there again? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you don't have another option in this location!”
Reviews.Author: lucianaene2000
Reviews.Content: We really didn't like this hotel. We stayed there for 4 days. In our first moment, a very fun recepcionist attended us and gave a lesson about our location and a map with all important sightseeings arround us. Something that we can't deny is that the location of this hotel is great: you can go from here to many sightseeings walking or you can take the tram that pass in the street right in front of it. But the hotel... First of all: it is a maze! To go to our room, we had to go to the first floor then walk by a corridor and then, go to the second floor. It seems that they had I very nice hotel (we saw very nice rooms in the first building when the maids were organizing them and left the door opened) and then they decided to buy a old building next to them and didn't renovate the place. And we had the bad luck to stay in the old one! First, the carpet in the corridor and stairs was old and spoiled. Second, our room was lime green and all the wiring was apparent. The only benefits in this room were that it had air condicioning and free internet access inside the room. At least, the bathroom was usable. My last comment is about the breakfast: the food was really nice, but the staff seemed a little lost. The room that they used to serve the breakfast was really tight. So, to find a place to seat and all kinds of food that they served, we had to arrive early. In one of the days that we were there, we went to the breakfast after 8 o'clock the bread was gone (and they didn't replace it) and we only found a place to seat because we put the dirty dished in one side of the table and ate in the other side. And the dirty dishes were there until we left...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Dadinova
Reviews.Content: Very good and comfortable hotel. 7 min walking to the Ayasofya and Blue Mosque, 5 min to Gulhane park (very beautiful place to relax after hard walking days of sightseeing), 2 min walking to Gulhane tram station, 15 min walking to Galata bridge. Room was small but well equipped for comfort staying. Beds are clean, soft pillows, clean and soft towels. WC and bath tube are also clean. Room service was provided daily. TV with many international channels in English and French, German, Italian and Russian channels. Breakfast was nice. Always the same, but fresh and tasty: several types of corn flakes, two type of cheese, fresh vegetables, cream, peanut butter, different sorts of bread, coffee, tea, juice, sausages, fruits, oriental sweets. Hotel stuff is very friendly! There is the Red river pub on the ground floor of the hotel. Nice cuisine and waiters). Opportunity to watch football matches on TV )). The disadvantage was view from window - tram line and crowdy street. I stayed in Ilkay hotel during my forth visit to Istanbul, that is why I am able to compare different hotels. Ilkay hotel is really very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: Reensx
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay in this hotel but when we arrived they informed us that there had been a leak and the rooms were flooded which sunk my heart a little. He said not to worry as we were being upgraded to a 4* hotel a few doors down at no extra cost. They dealt with the issue greatly and it was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: kentmoney1
Reviews.Content: I thought my stay at The Ilkay was pleasant. Nothing to write home about but it did the job. The staff was friendly. The room was clean and the bed very comfy The wifi was free of charge which is a Big plus and breakfast was pretty good. Red river Pub which is the restaurant before the hotel served some great food and drinks. The location is great. The tram stop is nearby which can take you uphill to the old town attractions such as the Topkapi palace and the Blue Mosque or down hill and across the Galata bridge to the Metro which you can take to Taksim Square. Two Turkish Liras gets you a coin to enter the metro platform. Overall it was a pleasant experience. It's a wonderful location and you will be able to tackle alot of Istanbul from this location. Safe travels.

Reviews.Title: “A surprisingly good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherrywafa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, and with good public transport system nearby (tram) authentic and affordable turkish food nearby (hocapasa street- 5-6 mins walking time), and cheaper souvenir shops. We booked 3 rooms.1 double room and 3 twin bed rooms and were given the double room and 1 twin room at the new wing. we were surprised at the quality and cleanliness of the rooms, rather posh for a budget hotel, which includes a flat tv screen. The rooms at the new wing is posh, but rather small. the double room is smaller than the twin room, so travelers who need more space, request for a twin room rather than a double room-limited space to walk around. The other twin room was located in the older wing, Clean, but furniture is a bit outdated but the hotel compensate it with a larger space. It even has a sofa to sit on. So it was still worth it. Breakfast is good and sufficient. The staff was super accommodating and friendly. Dont forget to reserve a dinner at Imbat Restaurant at Ilkay's sister hotel nearby. A posh restaurant with delicious Mediterranean Turkish cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean budget hotel with great location, value, and service”
Reviews.Author: Dessertmon
Reviews.Content: Ilkay Hotel is a clean budget hotel in Sirkeci district, with excellent value and great service. It fills the budget hotel role among the Sirkeci Group of hotels and restaurants, and offers terrific location, great value, and friendly service to budget-conscious independent travelers. Sirkeci, in our opinion, is the most convenient lodging district for sightseers on foot, even more so than the popular Cankurtaran (Sultanahmet) area. First, Sirkeci is located between EminÃ¶nÃ¼ and GÃ¼lhane. Much of the old town including the Sultanahmet area to the East, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, SÃ¼leymaniye to the West, and even Galata and KarakÃ¶y in southern new town can be reached on foot. Also, the T1 Tram line runs through the area, which provides easy access to the new town (KabataÅŸ Tram terminus is very close to DolmabahÃ§e Palace and a short F1 funicular ride away from Taksim Square) as well as Grand Bazaar (Ã‡emberlitaÅŸ or BeyazÄ±t stations). Ilkay Hotel is located on HÃ¼davendigar Caddesi (the Tram runs through this street), and both GÃ¼lhane and Sirkeci stations are just a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. This also makes the trip to/from the AtatÃ¼rk International Airport (IST) easy; to go to IST, hop on T1 tram at GÃ¼lhane, and transfer to M1 Metro at Zeytinburnu. Finally, nearby EminÃ¶nÃ¼ is the hub for all those ferries to Bosphorus, Asian side, and Golden Horn, as well as a major bus terminal (there are buses for EyÃ¼p, Fatih Mosque, Kariye MÃ¼zesi, etc). Overall, Sirkeci is a better lodging location for seeing all of Istanbul and beyond, while Cankurtaran is more suitable for quick few-day trips confined within Sultanahmet area (for shopping/gourmet/business trips, though, weâ€™d consider the new town). Ilkay is very attractive value-wise. Its rate is highly competitive, and there are good special offers; free airport pickup for booking three or more nights, a family card that gives 10% discount at some of the Sirkeci Group restaurants (though we found that they arenâ€™t necessarily among the best, and American Express can give the same discount), 1 night free for booking seven nights (i.e. paying for only six nights), and 7% discount for paying upfront in Euro cash. We took advantage of all of these to reduce the travel cost down to the level only some guesthouses could match. The hotel is also well-maintained; room was clean and quiet (apparently higher the better), staffs were attentive, breakfast buffet was satisfactory (not many items but generally good quality). For stocking up on water and snacks, there are three small marts just across the street. For those with a sweet tooth, the wonderful Turkish Delights (lokum) of Ali Muhiddin HacÄ± Bekir and baklavas of HafÄ±z Mustafa Åžekerlemeleri are nearby, too. Sure, this is a small budget hotel. The elevators are so small that they fill up with three people or a couple with a suitcase. Room is air-conditioned but with very few amenities â€“ shampoo, liquid soap, hair-dryer, a small wall-hung TV, and thatâ€™s about it. Bathroom is clean, but not particularly well-designed; at washbasin, we kept bumping our heads into an amenity tray, it was hard not to keep water from spilling onto the toilet paper hanger, and water leaked at shower head. Receipts are hand-written, and one front-desk position plays all â€“ receptionist, cashier, and concierge. However, none of the above small shortcomings distracted us from having a very satisfactory and pleasant stay. Everything from airport pickup, check-in, bookings for a day-trip and a show, to the last quick lunch at Red River, the hotel cafÃ©, went smoothly. And the most extraordinary thing was the level of commitment shown by many staff members and KÃ¼bra, the guest manager. The front desk promptly checked our bathroom when we mentioned the leaking shower head (though it wasnâ€™t completely fixed). Housekeeping was consistently well-done. KÃ¼bra gave a friendly orientation upon our arrival, asking our plans and giving advices. She would periodically check on how we fared throughout the trip. KÃ¼bra and another staff member at night shift asked about our day trip and the show, and it was clear that they were genuinely interested in our satisfaction, a rarity even at luxury resorts. Ilkay is a budget hotel blessed with very good location, even better value, and some truly outstanding staff. Yes, there are hotels with much better faÃ§ade and facility, with more elegance and sophistication, with lovely atmosphere and luxurious service, and with well-trained and disciplined staff. Ilkay does not enjoy all those, and has its rough edges. KÃ¼bra and other staffâ€™s genuine hospitality, however, along with its attractive value, more than compensate the lack of some amenities and elegance. We had great overall satisfaction with this charming small hotel, and would not hesitate to book again were we to return to Istanbul. Maybe not a perfect five point, but very close to it (this is my first time giving a five in TripAdvisor). We recommend Ilkay to any sightseeing traveler who can overlook a little lack of physical amenities and formality for a warm demonstration of Turkish friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Sue D
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Istanbul and we were not disappointed. The Ilkay Hotel is a great hotel and ideally placed for visiting Topaki Palace, Blue Mosque etc. The hotel was very clean and comfortable, staff really helpful and friendly and breakfasts really good. We were met the night we arrived by the hotel's representative Kubra who sat down with us and helped us plan our sightseeing etc. Having a friendly bar attached to the hotel was also very useful. We would definitely highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: AdilHussain263
Reviews.Content: Staying at ILKAY Hotel was as though I didn't even leave my home! I felt totally at home here and would even pay double what I did for my stay! The hotel is in the perfect location; right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of modern-day Turkey and all the confusing but great sights! I would also like to mention one particular member of staff SEDAT who made my stay so much more enjoyable... He was the first person we saw when we checked in and the last person as we left and it was a pleasure from beginning to end to have his company and guidance throughout our stay! Thank you very much Sedat and thank you to ILKAY Hotel! Inshallah I will also return soon and I have no doubts about where I will be staying! And who I would like to be serving me! Adil from Birmingham, England!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: shmhus
Reviews.Content: When booking Hotel Ilkay for a recent trip to Istanbul, it sounded like an ideally-located, low-budget base to primarily sleep, since we had plans to see all of the sights every day. What I wasn't expecting was the service, cleanliness and modernity of a 5 star hotel! The complimentary airport pick-up was a huge relief and went very smoothly, spotting our driver holding my name as soon as we emerged from arrivals. Although we booked and paid for a triple room, we were upgraded to a beautiful suite with no extra charge. As soon as we entered the hotel, Sedat at the reception desk gave us a most informative introduction to Istanbul, complete with maps and a "Family Card", giving us a 10% discount at all of the Sirkeci group's restaurants! The room, itself, was clean, spacious and fully air-conditioned - we could not have asked for more and were expecting a lot less. On top of that, there was also a complimentary breakfast buffet, which was ideal for starting a long day of sight-seeing, complete with just-squeezed, fresh orange juice. The sheets and towels were changed everyday and the room always smelt so beautiful. I didn't spend enough time in the hotel to get to know all the staff but it was made obvious many times by themselves that they were there if ever we needed anything. The one staff member we did get to know, as he was working the night shift when we would arrive back, was Sedat. A brilliantly charming man who was always full of great advice with a smile. He went the extra mile and really added to my amazing stay in Istanbul. Thank you :-)

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: SanahUK
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ilkay truly became our home away from home for the 6 nights we stayed there. It is without doubt the most distinctive hotel I have ever seen with its colourful adjoined souvenir shop where we did a lot if our present buying! We could not have been happier with its location, just walking distance from the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar and the Spice Bazaar, not to mention a little grocery shop and handbag shop right across the street, both of which we visited almost every day. The hotel itself is extremely well run, clean and most importantly has the friendliest and most helpful staff. Special mention has to go to Sedat at reception, who took the time to give us some excellent advice on much cheaper markets in the area, which ended up saving us a lot of money! His smile was always a welcome sight to come back to at the end of a tiring day. Our trip just would not have been the same without him, he is truly a valuable asset to Hotel Ilkay and we very much hope he will still be there when we come back next year. Sanah from England, UK

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Inga-Lill T
Reviews.Content: The rooms, the location, the proffesional and friendly staff, the breakfast everything was perfect. Close to Topkapi. Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque,Spicebazar, Grand Bazar, shopping you, name it. We had a great time and if we go back to Istanbul we will stay at Ilkay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ilkay”
Reviews.Author: ais-k
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in fantastic location, within walking distance of all the main attractions that Istanbul has to offer. However it needs modernisation. It is ok for a short break & has the basics.I don't think it's suitable for the families or the elderly, the restaurant does not offer much choice, the staff were great, we had issues with plumbing in the bathroom they sorted it straightaway.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I stayed in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Khalid181
Reviews.Content: Actually I don't know where to start from. Location is perfect , rooms are nice, and the more awesomeness is the staff of the hotel. specially the receptionist Sadat. In-fact he was so helpful guy, and really kind person. He helped me many times by advice to go in a good places and more than that. On the other hand, the beautiful welcoming, and smile I had from the adviser lady, defiantly I'll come back again to this hotel, and I strongly recommend to stay in this hotel. Best Regards, Khalid

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from a week at the Ilkay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John61_11
Reviews.Content: This is a Hotel very close to all you may want to see in Istanbul. All the staff are very helpfull and friendly and they all speek good English. The food is of a very high standard and the towels and bedding are changed daily and the bathroom cleaned. Everything is very cleen and the rooms are decorated to a good standard. The beds are a little on the firm side for me and the aircon motor outside of the bedroom window was loud. Other than that this is a great place to stay! We were even offered a discount for paying on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, teeny elevators, Great City”
Reviews.Author: nicolesouth
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ilkay was easy to find, being located really close to the tram. We were within walking distance of almost anything we wanted to see -- the Aya Sofia, the Grand Bazaar, Topkapi. There are tons of restaurants nearby that all really want your patronage. If you're claustrophobic, get a room on a lower floor -- the lifts can only carry 2 to 3 people at a time. Otherwise, the rooms were comfortable, just not very sound proof. The staff were very nice and helpful. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I feel like in heaven at ilkay hotel”
Reviews.Author: AntonioMami
Reviews.Content: First time we went in Istanbul we settled at Ilkay Hotel in 2007 and since then every year we came to Istanbul we stayed at Ilkay hotel because it's the best hotel ever with the most kind and the best staff in the world :3 If u want a good deal at the hotel ask for the receptionists named : Ugur or Fatih they are the best receptionists i've met so far so if you want a nice and relaxing trip go to Istanbul at Ilkay hotel Guaranted Comfort!!!!

Reviews.Title: “There is only one word to say,GREATTTTT:)”
Reviews.Author: B J
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul for a short holiday and I realize that I did very good choose.Ilkay hotel has really good location close to two tram station and all historical places you have to see and has nice rooms also good stuff thanks a lot 'Mr.Sugar,Coban and Meral for your hospitalty see you again at Ilkay hotel:)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: julian m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ilkay Hotel in the Sirkeci region of Istanbul for four nights during the last few weeks. The accommodations were very comfortable and the staff were extremely helpful throughout our entire stay. The hotel is conveniently located near the tram to get you into other parts of Istanbul. There were lots of lovely shops and restaurants around the hotel.We had a most enjoyable stay in this hotel in istanbul. My choice for our next visit is easy.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: syed R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. Helpful staff, free huge breakfast, clean & modern rooms, free internet, close to metro. Located in a touristy area but you have all the soveniour shops, resteraunts, cafes, bakeries, sweet shops right outside your window. wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cheap, Safe, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: LK53211
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very basic -- single beds, no frills, not a lot of "character." But it was clean, it had AC, the staff was friendly, the breakfast was good, and the location was great. It was an easy walk to the major tourist spots and to the ferries and other forms of public transit.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: thierry_grenade
Reviews.Content: We ve chosen this hotel because of all the good reviews on trip advisor but we were in this old building and the family room was definetly not a 3 stars hotel. The carpet on the floor was not good. It was doing waves... The bathroom was good but this family room was not like the one on the web site. AC was in only 1 room, not in both. The breakfast was all right, the staff was friendly. It worths to spend a few euros more to get a real 3 stars hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and experience”
Reviews.Author: Pureziuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ilkay hotel for 5 nights and I must say that this hotel is exceptional and very good value for money. It has a mixture of rooms depending on what your budget is. The room we had was very good and very clean especially the bathroom and toilet. The staff are excellent and very very friendly and co-operative especially ugur at reception, he is the man to see, he was a big help. Overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Among best of its type -- Budget”
Reviews.Author: RobCope
Reviews.Content: Wife, Angie, and I stayed at the Ilkay Hotel and returned. Why? Clean, modern bathrooms, surprisingly quiet given its central location among the places to see in Istanbul, and also directly on one of the world's best tram lines. Walk to the colorful waterfront. The staff at the desk, particulary man named 'Ugur,' were exceptional for service and -- except for restaurant advice (they do not eat locally)-- could be relied upon for everything from mail to airport pickup and delivery. The breakfast was beyond all anyone needs to start a day. Don't know about all the rooms but, both times, felt as if we had a suite -- more than a bedroom. No un-needed deluxe features. Two elevators to the 5 floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Tulgas
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for exploring Istanbul and very friendly and helpful staff specially Ugur in reception. Room was clean and big enough. The hotel's pub is a plus. Good food and drink at very reasonable prices. 100% recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - Fabuleux - Fabuloso!”
Reviews.Author: Viviajes
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days there. I went with my husband to Istanbul to visit the city and we booked this hotel thorough their web site because of the good comments that I found here. It could not be better! The service was perfect and we got more than we expected for the money that we paid. The hotel belongs to the â€œSirkeci Groupâ€� and follows high standards of quality, hygiene and client service. Each hotel in the group has a fantastic restaurant which we recommend absolutely: Pasazade, Imbat and Neyzade. We tried all of them and were delicious. In the hotel there is the Red River Pub, a good place to have a drink or a delicious hamburger. The hotel is near from the main attractions that we could reach walking: Hagia Sophia Museum, Archeological Museums, Topkapi Palace, The Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Sirkeci train station, Spices Bazaar, Yeni Camii, Galataâ€™s Bridge. For transportation, the hotel is in â€œthe middleâ€� of two tram stops: Gulhane and Sirkeci. And in EminÃ¶nÃ¼, which is 15 minutes walking, we got buses and lots of boats to Golden Horn, Bosphorus and Asian side. In front of the hotel there are stores, souvenirs shops, restaurants, a supermarket and a pharmacy. We had a big double room on the 3rd floor with a living room, a big bathroom with bath and three wardrobes. Our room was always clean: the bathroom, the bed, the sheets, the pillows, the towels, etc. At the desk we got a â€œsafety boxâ€� free of charge. There is and internet station in the lobby and wi-fi service if you have your computer. When we arrived we got our â€œFamily Cardâ€� to have 10% discount in any of the Sirkeci Group Restaurants. At the breakfast we always find something to eat: fruits, yogurt, scrambled eggs, boiled-eggs, sausages, olives, tomatoes, cucumber and different sorts of bread, cereals, jam and cheese. We even had lokum and halva. To drink, there is coffee, tea, milk, orange juice. At the reception there was always somebody ready to help us and to say hello when we arrive every day. This made us feel like in home. Language was not a problem: all of them speak English. Moreover, Ugur speaks Spanish and Fatih speaks French. We only have good memories from our stay in this hotel. And for me was particularly special because I spent my birthday there and when we went back to the hotel in the afternoon they had a chocolate cake for me. It touched my heart and I really appreciate it. Many thanks to Seda (the Manager), who was always willing to listen to our comments. And many thanks too to Ugur and Sedat at the desk that helped us a lot with their advice, recommendations and map directions. You made our holidays unforgettable. For us this hotel was fabulous. Not only for its location, but especially for the people who work there and made everything to become our stay in Istanbul in a memorable experience. We want to come back to Istanbul, and for sure, to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend without reservation!”
Reviews.Author: fatherpaul00
Reviews.Content: First impressions were misleading: the hotel was being refurbished during our stay -new lift and decorators in the hallway and reception. When we left it looked lovely! All the staff were so friendly and helpful especially Sulyeman our waiter, musician and friend! My room 605 had wonderful far-reaching views of the seas. It was clean and the bed was so comfortable -I hope that they will have fiven a little tender care to the shower and replaced the worn out carpet by now -plenty on offer all round Istanbul! The dining room was a delightful surprise for an excellent breakfast and the bar was very popular and a convenient rendez-vous. Thank you staff and congratulations! Asalaam akeicum!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Cihan028
Reviews.Content: My name is Cihan and I have stayed at this hotel for a month during my Business trip, I have booked in and out of the Hotel but when ever I had to come back to Istanbul, I came back to Ilkay hotel because of the atmosphere, the Freindly Staff and everything that goes with the Hotel. I would like to thank, Sherrif, Ercan, Emine, Harika and all other staff which I cannot remember their names at this very moment, but I thank them all for them making me feel like I was at home and it was llike going back home after meetings I have had all day. Once again I thank you very much and will recommend everyone to your Hotel Kind Regards: Cihan

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location to explore Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: Willy2007
Reviews.Content: During the summer, I spent with my family 4 days at the Hotel Ilkay in Istanbul. Istanbul is a really big city, with serious traffic and distance issues, so location of a hotel is absolutely a priority if you do not want to spend hours in the traffic. The Ilkay Hotel is located in a busy street in the Golden Horn, just a few minutes from the main attractions of the city, within walking distance. Hotel is basic but very clean with a great location. Some comments about the hotel : - Location The Hotel is located on a busy street in the Golden Horn , just a few meters away from the top attractions of Istanbul. You can walk to most of the attractions, To move further away , the tram runs in front of the hotel. Across the hotel you can find multiple restaurants, souvenirs shops,etc. -Transportation to /From the Hotel Istanbul has 2 airports. We arrived to the main one ( Ataturk International in the European side ). From there a taxi ride takes around 40 minutes to the Golden Horn. Note that the taxi driver might try to drop you 4 blocks away from the hotel, indicating that can not enter to the street of the hotel. It is not a big deal , but after a long light and with the luggage, is better to be dropped in front of the hotel. So check in advance with the driver ! On the way back to the airport, reception can order a taxi that will pick you up outside the hotel. - Reception The reception staff was very friendly and efficient. When I arrived, in 5 minutes completed the registration process, providing us maps and directions from the hotel. - Rooms I booked two double rooms We got rooms in the renovated area. The rooms were clean, good size comfortable beds, TVs. The bathroom is very clean also. Our rooms faced the street, which is really busy, but the noise was acceptable to have a good sleep. - Breakfast The hotel provides breakfast,, which has good options and the quality is ok. - Internet There is an internet station next to the lobby, which worked fine. - Atmosphere of the hotel The hotel is family oriented, so we felt very comfortable all the time. I would highly recommend the Ilkay Hotel in Istanbul , as you will have a clean place to stay, very close to the main touristic places and good value for your money !

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for discover Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lt1976
Reviews.Content: Me and my gf stayed at Ilkay for 7 nights, January 2011, the best hotel for discover the city. The location is close to H Sofia, on the road to Galata Bridge, every destination is reachable by foot. Small rooms but very clean, nice service, usual breakfast. Best value, i reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “couples having sex vs low prices”
Reviews.Author: enizagam
Reviews.Content: Great buget hotel. Location can't be beat. Friendly and helpful staff. Very clean room. Paper thin walls. The nosie from couples having sex may wake you and your children up. Children under 10 may accept cats in the alley as the source of noise.

Reviews.Title: “I congradge Ilkay Hotel for everything!”
Reviews.Author: Georgina1230
Reviews.Content: I was there for about one week, and my purpose was business, i can also tell that this was my third time visiting Istanbul,but at the same time it was my First time at Ilkay hotel. I had the best service all the time and of all the time especially from the reception staff a guy named UGUR, well he was polite, honest, and always ready for all the times we needed! And I feel lucky for setteling in this hotel! Next time when i will visit Istanbul for sure I will chose to stay at ILKAY HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Snowflake25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ilkay for 6 nights. Our room was small but spotless. There was air conditioning but most nights we slept with the window over looking the street open and were not disturbed by noise. The staff were friendly and always willing to lend assistance. We appreciated the airport pick up and they also arranged for our return trip to airport early in the morning. The breakfast room was clean and well attended by staff, often replenishing items when they ran out. The location was excellent. Lots of restaurants to chose from within walking distance. We were able to walk to all the major sites, but tram station is convenient if you require it. Our favorite place to relax at the end of the day was the Red River Pub. Friendly staff and cold beverages!!! WIFI was available at the pub or in the hotel lobby. We would recommend this to all our friends and would certainly stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible. Old. Tiniest room. very noisy”
Reviews.Author: hhkiwi
Reviews.Content: Do NOT make the same mistake Ä° did. Avoid this dump. Stayed two nights. Wish Ä° hadn't. Not one good or decent nights sleep. Back room faced back of hotel and all night there was a constant. nonstop motor or generator noise. Smallest hotel room i'd even been in. Ä±,m only 5 feet 4 Ä±nches and weÄ±gh 120 pounds and Ä± found Ä±t cramped. Had to sit sideways on toilet so knee wouldn't hit the wall. shower Ä±s lÄ±terally only 1 feet by 2 feet. Whole place Ä±s rundown. Breakfast Ä±s served Ä±n basement. ThÄ±s Ä±s only 1 star hotel - EXPEDIA Ä±s wrong when Ä±t gave Ä±t three stars. belÄ±eve me. pay a lÄ±ttle more and stay places recommended by lonely planet.

Reviews.Title: “If i return to Istanbul, i would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Lisa14112
Reviews.Content: And my words above can be best advirtisment for this hotel. I really find this place a good combination of price and quality. I was staying there in the end of august with my friends in double room apartment. Rooms are quite big, clean and cozy. Hotel is situated in quite citycenter, next to the gulhane tramvay station, so that it becomes comfortable to reach any destination you would like both by foot and with transport in shortest time. Friendly servicemen and receptionists, ready to help you in any moment you will need it and with any question you will come, make your presence in this place even more enjoyable. Especially i would like to mention receptionist UGUR, to whom it was real pleasure to appeal with any ask, and how i observed, to take an answer not even in english or spanish, which he talks perfectly, but tried to help even to some russians and arabians, who were not able to speak any language except their own. Hotel includes free breakfasts, which are quite acceptable, though in any time you can use facilities of nearby restaurant, which is placed inside the ilkay. If you re looking for a simple but really nice place to stay in during your trip to istanbul Ilkay hotel will be right choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sinem2801
Reviews.Content: I was there for a few days with my sister. It was a greatfull trip in Istanbul and the accomodation was perfect. The rooms were clean and also quiet. The personal was very friendly, the service was very nice. The hotel is very central. You don't have a long way to go sightseeing or shopping and also the railway station is at next. You can go by walking to the port to go to the asian part of Istanbul. And the best was the "Red River Pub". I think it was the best Pub in this area. The personal is very friendly and it is very comfortabel. The atmosphere and the music were harmoniously. I think the menu was also okay. In my next trip to Istanbul I will take the same hotel and will also recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay- even for backpackers”
Reviews.Author: Laurareane
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We had a huge room that had a sitting room and a bedroom. Large bathroom with a bathtub! Quiet, clean and comfortable beds. Breakfast was great- even had cereal After traveling for a month before reaching this hotel I was so surprised. It was worth every penny The location is but a few minutes walk to Agia sophia, blue mosque and Topakapi palace and so close to the tram. Highly recommend. For those staying >3 nights, complimentary pick up from the airport. Note to travelers, 7% cash discount must be mentioned on arrival!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, location and tidiness”
Reviews.Author: susvegara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week last month and I would recomend it as long as you are on a budget and you are looking for location convenience. The hotel is located right in the middle of everything with the longest (and most useful) line of tram right in front of it and a tram stop at a 5 min walk. Shops and restaurants along the street and surroundings as well. It's a small hotel, rooms are quite small, but clean and there's a maid that comes daily to tidy it up. The air conditioning works which is a plus, if you visit Istanbul in summer and the windows stop any noise from the outside so you sleep pretty well. The bed, we had a double bed, not twins, is not too big but enough but they only put one sort of sheet on top of it that's quite small for the bed's size, but since it was summer it didn't matter too much. No blinds, just curtains that didn't cover the whole window but, again, we managed. TV was a small one but had like a million channels included some in english, german, spanish or french. The bathroom was very small, the light was not quite bright enough as well and the curtain on the shower didn't really stop the water from running all over the place, but, again, it was clean, we had warm water, clean towels, toilet paper and a hairdryer so it didn't matter much. The breakfast is quite decent, they have bread, juice, coffee, tea, ham, cheese, yoghourt, olives, tomato, boiled egss, sausages, etc so it was enough. We didn't encounter any problems with our luggage, simply left it closed everyday, or with buggs in the bedroom; that's something we've heard of other hotels. It's got wifi on the lobby but you have to ask for the password, it's supposedly free but we never tried it. The bar downstairs is nice as well and opens until late but so do the other million bars in Istanbul. So, as I said, it's not your type of hotel if you are looking for a lot of space and luxuries but if you are looking for a cheap (we paid less than 60 â‚¬/night), clean and well located place, where to sleep, shower and rest, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location only”
Reviews.Author: Mishaella
Reviews.Content: Strengths: - good location - clean - friendly staff Weaknesses: - no minibar or fridge in the room (you'll certainly miss it if staying there during summer) - deposit box only at the reception - the breakfast buffet is not refilled as often as it should - small rooms

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: cotter_10
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location, staff in both Red River bar and the hotel friendly and helpful at all times, especially Fatih K at reception, rooms comfortable and clean and good selection at breakfast, cant fault this hotel for service or price and highly recommend for anyones stay in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: hilalahmed44
Reviews.Content: Front Office Staff: especially Umit and Fateh were extremely courteous, helpful and efficient. Service was very good and cleanliness was exceptional. The location could not be better. All in all great value on a low budget.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: irene2495
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience staying in Hotel Ilkay. Hotel has an excellent location: very close to Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia and Bosphorus. Price was reasonable, the hotel staff was very helpful, breakfast was tasty, diverse and filling. Some rooms are nicer than others and if you are not satisfied with a room that was offered to you, I encourage you to ask for a different one. The staff was very accomodating and willing to work with us to meet our needs. Overall, very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Calm within a Storm”
Reviews.Author: juliaannes
Reviews.Content: The staff was really friendly, and the breakfast bar was delicious with a large variety in selections. We enjoyed the free use of internet in the hotel. The hotel was perfectly located for walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, and the AyaSofya. It was located right in the heart of the tourist area of Istanbul. You could step right out of the hotel and be in the highly crowded tourist area. That could be a plus or a minus, depending on the type of person you are. The hotel was also located within 3-5 minute walk of a beautiful park and the Galata Bridge. The hotel's air conditioning worked very well!!! The toilets didn't work very well though. It didn't have much power to flush things down. :( We did have an issue with people smoking the last night we were there. We woke up in the middle of the night almost suffercating from smoke seeping under our doorway. Despite that, we had a great stay, and I would stay at the Ilkay again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service - ten thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaintheWorld
Reviews.Content: Everything about my dealing with Ilkay Hotel in Istanbul was just perfect. When we arrived at the hotel, we were upgraded to the next door hotel, Orient Express. We went to the Orient Express but we were still helped greatly by the staff at Ilkay (especially Ceren). I can honestly say that I've never been treated so well in any of the many posh hotels in which I have stayed throughout the world. The staff was courteous, prompt, kind,...human...I do not have enough words to express our gratitude to Ceren and her colleagues at both Ilkay and Orient Express.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Richard A B 1
Reviews.Content: I have had a four night stay at the Ilkay Hotel during June. The hotel is in a good location. A five minute walk in one direction is the Sultanahmet Square where the Topkapi Palace, Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Hippodrome are situated. A five minute walk in the other directions is the Bosphorus, Golden Horn and Sirkeci Station. The room met my requirements, having a good bed and facilities to wash and shower and it was cleaned well daily. The staff at reception and at the Red River bar were friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to explore the important sights of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but very bad rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nashoo
Reviews.Content: It has a very good location, walking distance to Sirkeci train station, Spice Bazaar, Archeology Museum, Topkapi Palace. Public transportation is less than 100m away. The hotel is not accesible by car (50m to nearest drop-off). They have no free parking, I was directed to nearby parking lots (about 8 euro/day). They have no wireless internet in the rooms, but they say it is available in the rooftop restaurant (didn't check). They have a computer connected to the Internet in the lobby, but in case it is not used by someone else access is limited to 15 minutes. Rooms are old, wavy walls painted in a hurry, broken tiles in the bathroom, generally a 'dirty' look. Furniture is also very old (like '80s). They do have air conditioning which was a bless in June.

Reviews.Title: “The location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: Blackangel85
Reviews.Content: I spent two weeks in Ilkay Hotel, The hotel is really beautiful! Good location, clean rooms, good beds (mattresses), The staff was very friendly. The location is very close to the center. It really is a must and I'm sure one more time, A great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Yes we would Return”
Reviews.Author: brianp021
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is as usual an Expedia good choice, very good location and central for all areas. The hotel is clean and tidy, rooms are smallish but when all you want is a good bed and somewhere to wash and shower, what more do you want. The reception staff and the Red River bar staff were all very polite and helpful at all times. The breakfast you could only say fair as one of the young male waiters looked as if he did not want to be there and when he was on he was very slow in re stocking low or run out items. The breakfast was also repetitive and no toaster was available. The holiday in some ways was spoilt by the strike action by British Airways; Expedia has been very poor during this strike action, no priority help line or normal exchange line to help customers, just their 0870 number which I had to wait on one occasion for 54 minutes before they answered overall two calls to them came to over 13 GBP. Pretty poor show when on the return flight. British Airways had a free line which I found I could use.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, competent staff, but definitely not a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotjerseygirl
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very convenient if you are going to spend most of your time sight seeing. I chose the word "convenient" rather than "great" because it is in area that is somewhat slummy. However, it was very close to many attractions like the Blue Mosque, the Aya Sofia, the Grand Bizarre, etc. There are several access points to public transportation within a few blocks if you want to visit other sights that are not within walking distance such as the Dolmabache Palace. There are, however, less roudy spots within a 1-2 mile radius from this hotel that are considerably more pleasant to walk through. And if you are interested in nightlife, you will need a taxi to visit the area of the best location to experience the nightlife. The staff was very competent and very helpful. Most of them spoke very good english and were never reluctant to answer questions or offer sound advice. However, travelers should be aware that the pictures of the rooms and the hotel in general do not represent the true style of the hotel. This hotel was rated as a 3 star hotel in some websites and a 4 star hotel in others. It is, in our opiniion, a 2 star hotel. The rooms were stuffy and small. They were also not as clean as they appear in the pictures. The space in the bathrooms was very limited and there is no tub. The curtain around the stand up shower area was less than standard. We wore plastic slippers while taking a shower. The rug was very old and the sheets were stained. The windows were very high but there was no screen to prevent flies and bugs to enter the room. The view was terrible in general. The breakfast was descent, standard, but the eating area was often hot and stuffy and breakfast time was a little earlier than what we preferred. It was served from 7-10am. In general, the hotel's key attraction is the staff and the convenient location. If you are looking for a cleaner neighborhood, a very good breakfast, a good view, and a very clean room with more amenities, this is not the hotel for you. The price is good when compared to other hotels but the reviews were very misleading as far as quality was concerned. We were disappointed to have relied on such reviews. But we were out all day sight enjoying the culture so we managed to endure the negative aspects of the stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and warm hotel in the middle of the Old City”
Reviews.Author: missIstanbul2010
Reviews.Content: Ilkay Hotel is located in a fantastic location, close to all the historical attractions , you can pratically reach out and touch Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque is an one minute walk, Topkapi Palace around the corner and the Gulhane Park is about a 5 minute walk. Rooms are spacious, bright, comfortable, attractively decorated, fresh and clean. The breakfast which was included in the rate had variety of food many typical Turkish cheeses and breads, fruit, eggs, cereal etc... the staff are very friendly and helpful with a good attitude, always have a smile on their face. I wish I could stay longer in Istanbul and also in this nice Hotel! Thanks for your helpfull and friendly attitude Ã–zkan , Ãœmit, Fatih and Ugur!

Reviews.Title: “The place to be...”
Reviews.Author: N2010Istanbul
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 10 night stay at this Hotel during the month of April and really enjoyed our time there. Location is excellent both quite and at the same time two or four minute walk away from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and from the many nice cafes and restaurants with a delicious Turkish cuisine. the quality of the hotel and room we stayed in was excellent, and the staff was also excellent - always friendly and ready to help. Special thanks to Ugur, Ãœmit, Fatih and Ã–zkan from the Red River Pub.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in the heart of Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: NN2010Istanbul
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in the heart of Old Istanbul. The staff is very nice and helpfull. Good hotel to enjoy the city and ideal for the tourist as it's near to the main sites and it's near to the tram, everything is within walking distance. Great hospitality, clean and comfortable rooms and ample breakfast. The Red River pub is highly recommended, the prices and services are very good! Special thanks to Ugur, Ãœmit, Fatih and Ã–zkan from Red RÄ±ver Pub.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with fine staff.”
Reviews.Author: AbbeStockholm
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife went to this great Hotel Ilkay which has been a very good experience , the staff was very nice, kind and talkative, the Hotel Ilkay is very central to everything in Istanbul, such as trains , busses other amusement places like museems such as " Sultan Ahmet" , "Blue mosque" and "Topkapi Palace" and other world heritage sites! There are several Fine and delicious restaurants nearby the turkish food is absolutely great. More about the hotel: Especially the staff was very kind and caring! I'd like to Especially thank all the staff members of the Hotel , Thank you for a very special time together with the staff and for the good standards in this hotel. Thanks to: Adem, Engin, Sherif, Safiye, Ercan, Cenk, Banu, Olkan, I had wrote their names while i stayed in the hotel! I recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, central to all the main sights”
Reviews.Author: kleefeld
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and helpful. The room is basic but the beds are comfortable, there is plenty of hot water and everything is very clean. The location is great - near all the main sights and on tram route. Breakfast buffet is good and there are plenty of places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent treatment in Ilkay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luimes
Reviews.Content: Last two weeks we stayed Ä±n the Ä°lkay Hotel in Ä°stanbul. We stayed in Ä°stanbul for a studytrip wÄ±th the department tourÄ±sm and leÄ±sure from the university of Saxion Deventer. We were supposed to stay here for one week but after the Icelands vulcano eruptÄ±on we we were forced to stay a couple of days longer. The Ä°lkay hotel offerd exellent services for the entire group and felt responsable for us. They provide special prices and services which made me feel like home. For example, one of the employees brought us to the airport for free to get some more information about our flights. Ä° just want to thank everybody from the Ä°lkay Hotel for the hospÄ±talÄ±ty they offered us, Ä° had a wonderful stay in Ä°stanbul and will never forget the hospÄ±talÄ±ty thought of this hotel! Special thanks to Mr. Faruk, the hotelmanager, Mr. Umit Mr. Fatih the and Mr. Ozkan from RÄ±ver Club

Reviews.Title: “You pay the location”
Reviews.Author: mcruley
Reviews.Content: I usually visit Istanbul and this is the second time I stayed in Ilkay hotel. It is a quite basic hotel, room are ok and bathrooms simple but clean. Perhaps breakfast is a bit repetitive and the bufe is limited. Personally, I chose this property based on its superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: KandyKorn143
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just returned from Istanbul and stayed 3 nights at Hotel Ilkay. If you are not fussed about luxury it is the ideal place to stay! The beds are comfy and the location is superb! The only slight down side is that the curtains are very thin so your room is flooded with light by 5:30 am. Also, the shower is just a drain you stand on in the corner with the cold shower curtain sticking to you constantly. But for the price who cares? The breakfast is beautiful and you are within walking distance to The Spice Market, The Blue Mosque and The Grand Bazaar! Best budget hotel I've stayed in by a mile!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: MTflygirl
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the world and stay in all sorts of hotels. For me, what makes a hotel memorable is not just the room/hotel appearance but the staff. At Hotel Ilkay the staff are extremely polite and helpful! Especially Umit who gave us great directions and advice. The room was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was nice with good selections. Ilkay is perfectly located within walking distance to all the major sites of Istanbul and the tram stop is very close by which makes it easy to get to from the airport. Ilkay may not be the Ritz but to me, it was better! I have already recommended it to other friends who will be visiting Istanbul soon!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive but really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TommoBrighton
Reviews.Content: It's a budget hotel but perfect for a short break in an interesting city. We had a lovely room with a sitting area. The most important bit for me is how comfortable the bed is, and it was. The rooms are clean, the staff are excellent, particularly Seker on reception. We had a lovely bathroom with a shower over the bath. There was even internet access in a room off reception. Our sitting room had a small TV but we didn't use it. The hotel is attached to the Red River restaurant/bar, which was a good meeting place with excellent service and good drinks. It is brilliantly located to walk to all the major sites in the old part of town and to get to the Bosphorous where you can take a boat to the Asian side, or walk across the Galata bridge. There are lots of other local places to eat & drink. The breakfast is adequate though not the best food in town.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in all meaning”
Reviews.Author: YousifKuwait
Reviews.Content: ilkay hotel is an amazing hotel.. very friendly staff especially my friend Mr. UÄŸur.. very helpful and supportive. Ä° enjoyed my honeymoon there and i really like the hotel location as it was in the middle of istanbul.. very close to blue mosque and hagia sofÄ±a,, grand bazar.. spice bazaar.. Mahmoud pasha.. and other nice places like Taksim square... beiÄ±ng Ä±n hotel ilkay was very pleasant and joyful. Yousif khader

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Feyabsenta
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the hotel Ilkay. The location of this hotel was EXCELENT! It is in the heart of Istanbul. 1 minute on foot to Topkapi Palace, Saint Sophia and The Blue Mosque. Our room was big and sunny. The heating was perfect. There was a condition in the room too. The room and the bath were very clean, without any smell. Bads were wide and comfortable, the sheets were perfectly clean. The breakfast was also very nice. There were no need to eat lots of meal there because there were so many good restorants all around the hotel. Free high-speed internet connection in the lobby. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, only the best words to the staff, especially to miss Ezgi Kepsutlu who decided all our problems. Thank you very much once again. Our next stay will be only in on of the hotels of Sirkegi Group!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ä°lkay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karel_1234
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located only minutes walkÄ±ng from some of Ä°stanbul's main attractions as there are the Aya Sophia, TopkapÄ± or the Yerebatan CÄ±stern. Rooms are simply but sufficiently furnished. TakÄ±ng breakfast certainly is advisory for Ä±t's prÄ±ce.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Vnbstn
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel very much and is very confortable and there are a nice rooms .The hotel was very clean and the staff were very welcoming.Helful and informative reception staff. The breakfast is delicious. . The breakfast was great! Lots of variety so you don't need to eat the same thing every day. This hotel is in the old city and within 7 minutes walking distance to the excellent Archaeology Museum and Topkapi Palace, the Sublime Porte. Hagia Sophia, the first cathedral, is also nearby, within walking distance. I advise anyone to Ilkay Hotel reservation when they go to istanbul

Reviews.Title: “The place you can call 'home' in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: AliyeTM
Reviews.Content: Ilkay is not the first time I stayed at. This time I stayed for a longer time. Ilkay is situated at the heart of old Istanbul. Most of the sightseeing sights are in a 5-10 min. walking distance. The tramline runs just in front of the hotel. And when you want to go to Taksim, the place to be for clubbing, it's just a couple of minutes with a cab. The staff is very friendly. Rooms are cleaned every day. The hotel has Wi-fi in the lobby plus free internet access by a PC overthere. Ilkay hotel is a low-budget hotel with maximum comfort. Definately a place to stay for those who wants to enjoy the city and relax at 'home'. Going back to the hotel at the end of the day, we always referred it as 'Let's go home', because this is just how it felt.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but well-located hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: Overall, I'd say the reviews so far for this hotel are a bit too generous. The facilities at this property are ADEQUATE, but not exactly nice. I'd rate the quality of the rooms 2 stars. They're old, small, and could use a bit of refurbishment. But not horrible -- and plenty of hot water. Hotel facilities in general are a bit worn. That said, the front desk staff is friendly and helpful, and there's a guest lounge behind the reception desk with a free computer. The breakfast spread is solidly 3 stars: I'm not a big fan of Turkish breakfasts, but this one is somewhat above average. The only real reason to stay here (if you get a good rate) is the location. For sightseeing for a couple of days, it is perfect. Most of the major sights in Istanbul are in Sultanahmet, and a few minutes walk from the hotel. While my stay was off-season, I did not find the touts in Sultanahmet to be overly oppresive. And you benefit from lots of restaurants, shops and "tourist infrastructure." The Ilkay in in the heart of all of this, and you really couldn't ask for better location.

Reviews.Title: “Very professional”
Reviews.Author: aroncaBraz_l
Reviews.Content: The employees are very nice and friendly.The receptionists, specially Ugur, are very helpful in all possible way we could imagine. He has good language skills (both English and Spanish) which made it very easy to go around the features of the city. The hotel offers good location to travelers in short stay, for it is close to the main attractions of Ä°stanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: al2912
Reviews.Content: Perfect 5 days stay with children, teenagers and elderly in the group. Very friendly staff, excellent location. Supermarket across the road, tram 100m, Sultan Ahmet/Aya Sophia/ spice market 10 minutes stroll away. Thoroughly enjoyed the stay. Remember, Ilkay hotel is a budget hotel with budget prices so don't book in here expecting a 5* hotel and you won't be disappointed. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: turkish-cypriot
Reviews.Content: This is a 2 Star hotel in Sirkeci Istanbul which is close to all the amenities historical sites travel connections shopping ect. This hotel is more than 2 star and more like 3 star. the hotel staff were very friendly and helpfull, the room very clean with clean towels and sheets every day. When we entered the room after we was out the rooms were aired and smelt clean. The breakfast was buffet style with the food being fresh and enough choice to satisfy anybody. This hotel is one of the best i have stayed in Istanbul with a central location for everthing. I would use this hotel next time i am inIstanbul and would highly recomend this hotel for its location for a short city break in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Nikoloz
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ilkay is very good choice for the offered price. Clean rooms, friendly staff, nice location, excellent breakfast. We needed to make phone call from airport to remind them to send the driver, but in ten minutes the car have come. Overall I recommend this hotel to the Istanbul travelers.

Reviews.Title: “very welcome, very satisfying to the hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: cl65amg
Reviews.Content: that's fine, it is well established, very good service, I am very pleased with this stay Ilkay hotel. I thank Mr. Umit Meral who helped me a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, centre located, friendly personel!”
Reviews.Author: natalyaGreece
Reviews.Content: Ilkay hotel is in a very good location, within a walking distance from the Grand Bazaar, Haya Sofia, Blue Mosque+many shops. It is also 15minutes walking to the tram service station tunel from which u can take it & in 3minutes go to Istiklal street. The reception personel was very friendly+spoke good english The rooms were clean, with TV+confortable beds I would like more variety in the breakfast If u need a room in a good location and travelling for few days its the perfect choice

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mampty
Reviews.Content: Visited the hotel with my sister for a long weekend. Booked through City Break.co.uk as an inclusive booking, using Easy Jet and Ilkay. We used istanbulairportshuffle @ 10 euros each way. which worked smoothly for us. Had to wait for passangers who didn't arrive on the inbound journey (don' t you wish people would have the courtesy of cancelling if the change their mind), and one lady got on the bus for the wrong airport on the way back, didn't realise, and started shouting at the driver to let her off on the motorway - the company coped with both challanges smoothly, so I was quite impressed. Unlike the first impression of the hotel room ( keep reading, and the scoring will make sense!) We were given keys to Room 202. Now learn from our mistake; if you are given this room ask to change immediately, It is cramped, dark, has a flat roof and fire escape right outside the window, suffers from noise from the surrounding rooms airconditioning units without its own working, and worst of all, when you shut the window to go out, on your return there is a very unpleasent smell of mouldy damp ! So, after a sleepless night, we spoke to them, and without any arguement or even discussion, a new room key appeared, our cases were relocated, and a nice bright sunny Room 511 was ours! After 4 days of climbing 5 flights of stairs we did debate if that was punishment for wingeing about the first room but there was the alternative of a lift so probably not ! The lift was one of those funny ones with only 3 sides and a moving wall so it was our choice to walk those stairs. Gave us an appetite for Breakfast, which was served in a basement room; nice spread of fresh bread, white and yellow cheese, ham, tomatoes, egg, cereals and stuff.
