Hotel also has free safety deposit boxes behind reception, locked luggage room so you can store after check out, free internet computer in a little lounge, but most of all really helpful friendly staff, who we often heard advising people how to get around Istanbul, where to go and when etc. Overall we loved the location most of all. Istanbul may be built on 7 hills but you don't have to be amazingly fit to cope with walking a lot of it. We kept meaning to get on a tram but everytime I would say 'it's only a couple of stops from the hotel, let's walk'. Now the shoe leather did take some punishment on all those cobbles, in fact, we have a broken heel to prove it, and the feet are still throbing from two days later, but we really we able to work up an appetite by walking everywhere. We used the ferry to get across to Kadikoy but otherwise across to Galeta, Grand Bazar, Blue Mosque, Aga Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Cisterns, and the Park were all walked to easily. The hotel also has the Red River pub to collapse into on your return for a cold beer. Prices are not much more than anywhere else in Istanbul and it has a comfortable and relaxing feel. We never ate there so can't comment on that. So, would I recommend? Yes - but not Room 202 !

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ilkay”
Reviews.Author: wisetraveller55
Reviews.Content: We are family of four. We stayed at Hotel Ilkay and Erboy Hotel (Sirkeci Group Hotels) in July 2009. At Ilkay, we had two double rooms â€“ (Room No 306 and 307). The breakfast was great, buffet style with lots of choice. The beds were comfortable. The air condition worked well. One of the rooms was facing some building work which we didnâ€™t mind as we hardly spent any time in the room and it was quiet at night. Hotel centrally located, easy walking distance to Old Town, the river, the station, the ferries, the tram and all the main attractions such as the Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Topkapi Palace etc. It is situated on a shopping street with supermarkets lots of souvenir shops and restaurants nearby as well. All in all, good value for a budget hotel. The hotel staffs were friendly especially Mr. Fatih Seker who was fantastic with all guests. He spoke fluent English and made our stay memorable. He was always willing to help and provided useful information about Istanbul. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this Hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Istanbul and would definitely stay at this hotel again. As mentioned above we also stayed at Erboy Hotel which is about 100 yards from Hotel Ilkay and ideally located for the main attraction as above. We had two double rooms here as well. The rooms were small, but manageable. The air conditioning was leaking and the toilet did not stop flushing. It made lot of noise. Phone between two rooms were not working (Rooms 310 and 311). We complained and got transferred to Room 407 and 408 and enjoyed our remaining days of the holidays. They arranged for our transfer to the airport free of charge due to the inconvenience caused to us. Plus point - the street level restaurant at the Erboy was great. Rooftop restaurant has great views.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: MawkieLondon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ilkay is right in the Old Town, 5 mins to Blue Mosque, Totkaki Palace and other attractions. A small lobby, and a larger lounge area (with free computers to use for internet) form the entrance of the Hotel. The small lifts take you to every floor. Our room faced onto the tram, which runs right past the Hotel. This was not noisy, the windows insulated the sound well. The room itself was spotlessly clean, the shower and toilet was also spotless. A small TV, desk, wardrobe and bedside tables completed the basic furnishings. Beds were very comfortable. Air conditioning in each room I saw worked well and very cold if you need be! Breakfast was included in our price, and it was plentiful and extensive. Buffet style, it has cereals, dried fruits, breads, Turkish muffins, eggs, sausages, yoghurts, cheeses and hams, tea, coffee, juice. All-in-all, I would definitely go back for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Two sides of one coin... choose the non smoker room.”
Reviews.Author: Keildest
Reviews.Content: At first we asked for a double room and a single, but when we arrived at the hotel we found that the double room had a double bed. We asked them if they could change it to a room with two single beds, and they were kind enough to change both rooms into double rooms with single beds no extra charge. Small set back was that one was a non smokers room, but it had a nice view of the street and was a nice room in general. The smokers room however had no view (except for a concrete wall 2 feet away from the window), no natural sunlight, no extra plugs for electric accessories (ie mobiles and cameras and what not) and a third rate bathroom. Appart from that the service was great, rooms were clean, breakfast was ample and closed at 10 am (rather than 9 as most places do) and the location was amazing. Oh! And the beds were superb! Except for the smokers window and lack of plugs the hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “Its ok for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: Dianne8868
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the end of May with 2 friends for 2 nights. Having read the reviews I thought this is too good to be true the price was right and it was in an ideal location. I had high expectations. The long ride from the airport on a busy Saturday afternoon wasnt ideal however we arrived in good time to drop our bags and head straight out again. I think on first impressions the hotel rooms are a little dated particularly the bathroom which had a very unusual shower cubicle that looked more like a large sink with a curtain round it. The bed was comfortable enough and the towels they provided were nice and big. Our room was facing some building work which we didnt mind as we had no intention of spending any time in the hotel. The reception at the hotel was always staffed although we were sometimes given conflicting information regarding best excursions and prices re taxi transfers to the airport etc they were mostly helpful and friendly. I had on 2 evenings serious stomach ache whilst I was in Istanbul not sure whether it was the water or something I ate which didnt help! Anyway I think Istanbul is an exciting place to visit with the spice bazaars and grand bazaar within walking distance from our hotel. The hotel also had breakfast that was plentiful and mostly the same each day. cold meats bread yoghurt cereals hot drinks fruit juiceThe hotel did not serve evening meals but you could use the sister hotel along the same road a couple of doors down. In any case there are so many restaurants in the area that it really didnt matter. All in all I think if you want a cheap and cheerful value for money accessible hotel and you are only here for a couple of nights that will allow you to explore the city then this is the place to book.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and great location!”
Reviews.Author: SonRLondon
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 day trip to Istanbul and we stayed a the Ilkay. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this Hotel, the air con worked well, we had a large room with a living area with TV and the bathroom looked like it has recently been refurbished. Even though it is close to a main shopping street with a tram, the noise was never a problem. The staff were friendly and so were the bar staff in the Red River which adjoins the hotel. Most of all the location really makes this a great place to stay. It is within walking distance of all the main attractions such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Topkapi Palace. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: bothsidesnow
Reviews.Content: A well known hotel very popular with those staying on a budget. Ultimately you get what you pay for, it's cheap so you don't expect The Ritz. Book with this in mind and you will be very happy here. Sure the shower floods the bathroom floor a bit, the toilet flush is a bit cranky, there's no safe or kettle in the room etc, However it's clean, the air con works well, the staff are helpful and the breakfast buffet is extensive. What gives this place the extra star is the perfect location, within easy walking distance to most of the major sights in the Old Town, the river, the baths, the markets, the station, the ferries, the tram etc. It's handily situated on a shopping street with supermarkets nearby and the double glazed windows cut out any Istanbul bustle and noise. TIP: If flying in to the further out Sabiha Gokcen airport (ie Easyjet), book the airport shuttle minibus in advance, you'll easily find it online. They meet you at the airport, holding a sign with your name on and will drop you at your hotel door, for just 10 Euro. A cab will cost way more than this and there is no metro, just a local bus. It took about an hour to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant weekend”
Reviews.Author: bluenose42
Reviews.Content: stayed in the ilkay hotel for 3 nights, brilliant weekend, hotel is basic but got the main 3 star features , the bar attatched to hotel very good (red river) the 2 staff in the evenings were brill especially Iran , he gave us good tips and advise of what to do etc , reception staff were also good at dealing with a couple of problems we had ie using the phone for a private taxi firm, Excellent location for all the sights some within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CPTtravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, so close to the sights and restaurants, an excellent base to see the city from. The rooms are very basic but clean and comfortable. The breakfast was good and the hotel facilities were modern and well-kept. I would definitely recommend this hotel to future guests who are travelling on a budget and want a place to lay their heads not too far from the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: mr_peterman
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was there breakfast, which had a large selection and was included in the room price. The hotel is in a good location, within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar and the Blue Mosque. There are also plenty of restaurants and pubs in the area. The hotel room itself was very average. Even though my room was a single one, there was no window that allowed light in the room. When I checked in, which was well after 2pm, the reception handed me the keys, but when I went up there, the room was still dirty! I was only here the one night, so it wasnt to much of a hassle, but I recommend not staying any longer.... or ask for a room with a window that allows light to enter! I probably woulnt go back to this hotel as I am sure there are better ones out there. It wasnt too bad though

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: supermanNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Stayed here first week of June 2009. six nights in all. this is your typical budget hotel. Rooms are small, the sun shines through the curtains in the morning, ie. early wake-up. The shower was warm & good pressure, just most of the water ends up on the floor, request extra towels to deal with this. There is a big dig site behind the hotel which our room overlooked. again more noise, so you get an early wake-up. but you should already be awake since the sun is shining into your room. the lift is tiny, and makes some noise which will wake light sleepers. one english channel on tv, bbc world. breakfast is included in the room rate, but it sucked, so we ate around the corner at a great bakery / cafe. The price is reasonable, but the best thing about this hotel is it's location. right in the heart of tourist central. you can easily reach stuff by foot, otherwise the tram stop is 1 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “2 and a half stars and average”
Reviews.Author: remyacb
Reviews.Content: the hotel is central and is walking distance to the main sights in istanbul. It also offers a good buffet breakfast. However - it is difficult to be dropped off at the hotel by taxi as the street has tram lines on it and cars very rarely drive on it - the rooms are too small, shower cubicles are minute and the decor is cheap - the tiny lifts/elevators are scary and if you have mobility problems, you will struggle - this is a budget hotel which is not three stars. i would give it two and a half stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: cheeseymouse
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. Literally a few minutes walk from Topkapi Palace and the Spice Bazaar. The Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque are only 15 mins walk away. The Grand Bazaar is a little further - more like 30 mins walk - and its worth noting that its shut on a Sunday. Immediately across the road is an abundance of restaurants and bars, all with the customary water pipes! We particularly liked the Salute restaurant (cross the road, go up the hill & you'll see it.) Really good quality, authentic food at sensible prices. The staff were very friendly too & even gave us complimentary apple tea. I'd advise against taking the Havas bus from Sabiha Gokcen airport into the city (10 Turkish Lira per person). It dumps you in the Taksim district and, when I asked the driver how to get to the Sirkeci district for the hotel, he just shrugged his shoulders. This is despite the same bus driver saying "Sirkeci, no problem" earlier! We had to then take a taxi to the hotel (a little under 15 Turkish Lira for the journey). It took 2 hours to reach the hotel from the airport. On the return trip, we used the Sabiha Gokcen airport shuttle white mini bus (we hadn't come across this at the airport, but had looked for it). You can pre-book your tickets from CNN Tours on the same street as the hotel (turn right out of the entrance & its a few doors down on the same side). It cost 25 Turkish Lira per person, but the great thing was it picked you up from directly outside the hotel. I'd allow 1 hour to get back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, expensive hotel but good location, wouldn't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: ajhcaw
Reviews.Content: Happy to stay in basic hotels but this didn't even have the telephone connected in spite of having one, no fridge, no safe and really basic accomodation. Not a problem but the price was more than it should have been. Would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ilkay was the perfect hotel for our trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Istanbul04
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but clean en tidy. The staff of this hotel is really friendly and helpfull. Breakfast is nice, there's a lot of choice, you can either have a traditional Turkish breakfast, or just yoghurt with fruit. The location of this hotel is very central, at a walking distance of some of the major sights, like the Blue Mosque, the Topkapi palace and the Aya Sophia. It's in a lively street and close to a tram stop and a train station.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikenfm
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Ilkay on two occasions with my wife. Both times we stayed there for several days. My wife is Turkish and currently lives in another part of the city but we need somewhere close to the city centre to stay when I go to Istanbul to be with her. The location of the hotel is superb for tourists visiting the city because it is within walking distance of all the major sights. It is also possible to walk into Taksim (the modern city centre) via the Galata Bridge which we would recommend anyone to do. If you do not like to walk then a taxi is relatively inexpensive. The hotelâ€™s rooms are very clean and of a good size compared to other hotels in Istanbul. The staff are very helpful and there is a great complimentary breakfast with lots of choice. In summary we would certainly recommend this great hotel to other people !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel Ilkay”
Reviews.Author: mast_lakandar
Reviews.Content: Our family comprising of me, wifey and two kids aged 8 and 4 stayed at Hotel Ilkay in the last week of February. We were looking for budget accommodation which would not be shabby and cheap. Based on the online research I chose Ilkay,and it turned out to be a good choice.The stay was pleasant. The location of Hotel is good. Its in the Sirkeci area which is short walk from Hagi Sofia/Blue Mosque and other attractions. The tram stations and the ferryboat stations are closeby and a short walk away. The Hotel arranged for a pickup from the Airport at a cost of Euro25. The room we were given was a Suite, as shown on the hotels web site. As we were a family of 4, they had converted the Sofa in the Living room into a bed. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The bathroom was clean and hot and cold water at good pressure was available. Adequate clean towels were provided in the room. The wash-basin in our bath room didn't have a stopper, however the same was provided by the reception desk when I brought it to their notice.The rooms were cleaned daily. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. They tried to meet the guests request and were ready with advice and tips. The breakfast in the room in the basement was plentiful & nice and set you up for the day. Room service is not available. However, when we wanted hot water etc we were directed towards the cafeteria/bar in the Hotel. There are plenty of restaurants in the vicinity. Wifi connectivity and a computer was available in the lounge area which could be used by guests for free. The security in the Hotel was good and secuirty cameras were covering all areas on all floors. Regarding negatives, the Hotel does get some noise from the Trams and vehicles passing on the road. It didnt affect us but could be an issue with light sleepers. One wished that the Hotel will provide electric kettles in the room so that guests could help themselves to tea/coffee. Overall the stay at Hotel Ilkay was comfortable and nice. I would recommend it to fellow travelers looking for budget accommodation and would definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: bookwurm70
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying a week at the Ilkay Hotel in Istanbul. I was very nervous about going because there are so many bad reviews of hotels in Istanbul and I could not afford a 5 star hotel. The Ilkay was perfect! The rooms were smallish, but very clean and definitely cleaned daily. The breakfast was great! Lots of variety so you don't need to eat the same thing every day. The best part was the price. It was already very reasonable for the part of the city but we reserved on their website and qualified for all three discounts: 3 or more nights and get a free airport pickup; pay on arrival in cash and get 7% discount; stay 7 nights and get one night free. With all those advantages it really brought the cost down. We simply withdrew the needed Euro from an ATM at the airport on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location for Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: taro_baap
Reviews.Content: Hotel ilkay is a great hotel. The location is excellent as it is walking distance to many attractions. It is approx. 20min. walk to Blue mosque and Hajia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. Also, the Bosphorus Sea is about 15 min walk as well. The staff is very friendly and buffet breakfast is good. The rooms are small, but very clean and decent. It is definetly worth the price you pay and an excellent hotel for someone travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Manuel Cuesta. Spain All about this hotel is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Macum60
Reviews.Content: All about this hotel is fantastic. staff very polite, the place very good. very clean and sweet. Next to the hotel there is a place called Red River, well,,,,,about Red River I have to say...JUST FANTASTIC TOO. It's a place where you can have a good time having a drink and talking to the staff, all of them are a very nice people, very polite and always making you to feel like if you were at home. THANKS SO MUCH TO ALL OF THEM. When I come back to Istanbul I am going to stay here. Ã‡OK TESEKURLER.

Reviews.Title: “Ilkay Hotel is the best hotel in Istanbul / Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Muzzyyy
Reviews.Content: ilkay hotel is the best hotel in istanbul. All employees are very professional and very customer friendly. for one low price you get a lot of hotel service employees .. and expensive hotels you are just a number Every morning you have breakfast. I have a nice time in ilkay hotel. I thank all the people of ilkay hotel, especially Mr UMIT almost everything for us regularly I advise anyone to Ilkay Hotel reservation when they go to istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Ilkay hotel your prefect choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: XelaEsp
Reviews.Content: Ilkay hotel is the perfect choice for you in Istanbul Very well situated at the historical area but the really important is the mix of the tradicional turkish hospitality and the kidness and professionality of all the staff . I am guest of Ilkay hotel three years ago .I travel to Istanbul five or six times on year and i can say Ilkay hotel is my home in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hola”
Reviews.Author: eric72Turkey
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel very much and is very confortable and there are a nice rooms and the people very friendly . The breakfast is delicious. And especÄ±al receptions his name Ä±s Ugur. When I come back to Ä°stanbul I WÄ±ll stay Ä±n thÄ±s hotel.

Reviews.Title: “superb location, very good value, no luxury”
Reviews.Author: halixol
Reviews.Content: We was in this hotel for our second New Year's eve in Istanbul and i must say that it was super choice. Location of this hotel is just 10min walk from Aya Sofia and centre and 1min walk from tram station for other destination located not in Sultanahmed and 3min of walk from Ferrys to everywhere. We have room in top floor and we have unique and marvelous view on Galata, Bosphorus Bridge and Asian's side Uskudar. Our room has also balcony. The hotel is but really budget hotel, so carpets are used on the hallways and so, rooms are small but rooms are cleans and without problems.Don't expect luxury but fair budget. Rooms has also functional AC either for heat or cold. Breakfast was common buffet and also without problems. We booked 5 nights and we got 1way airport transport without problem. We bougth airport transport in travel agency few doors next to this hotel for 4 euro per person, which was great price. Next to this hotel is Orient express owned by the same group which is nicer and spacier and little bit modern but also much more expensive. There is no muezzin/mosk nearby so you will not be disturbed in 5:50am when first muezzin calls starts. In surroundings is few supermarkets with latenight opening hours, various restaurans and fast foods. Only bad thing which could happen is, that in the back side of hotel is someone building some contruction site and maybe it could be little bit noisy for few years. But when we was there it was quite fine, only disturbance was caused when arrived truck with concrete. Our room number was 603.

Reviews.Title: “New year 09 in Ilkay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Damla_Russia
Reviews.Content: It is a perfect hotel!! The fact that prices match the quality as well as that the hotel is situated 5 minutes by foot till the Sultanahmet square and the St. Sophie's church is very important for those who came to see all the Istanbul's places of interest. The personnel of the hotel is very friendly and they speak not only English and Turkish, but also French and Spanish!(especially thanks UÄŸurr) They are very polite and always explained me - a person not familiar with Istanbul - how to get to each place I was interested in, either shops in Taksim or palace in Dolmabahche - Thanks so much Fatih and Umit ! I would definately recommend everyone to stay there when they visit Istanbul! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ldh86
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Ilkay Hotel in Sirkeci, Istanbul with my girlfriend (now fiance!). The location of the hotel is unbelievably good - less than a 10 minute walk to the Aya Sofya, right next to Gulhane Park, and barely 2 minutes from the nearest tram stop. The hotel is advertised as a budget one and you get what you pay for, but the price was extremely cheap for the location and the room was excellent - good shower facilities and great heating (it was snowing almost all holiday!). Reception staff are multilingual and very helpful with directions and advice etc. The Red River Pub underneath the hotel is also amazing! It's a themed pub based on an American Western film, and has a very warm feel to it. We spent New Year's Eve in the pub and the staff worked very hard to make everyone feel welcome, and did their best to keep festivities going. A special mention to Ercan Bakan the barman - went out of his way to show us how to use the heater in our room (which we thought was broken) and also had a smile on his face for the whole break - great barman and a great guy! I heartily recommend the Ilkay Hotel as a cheaper alternative to some of the overpriced accommodation in Istanbul. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Winter hollidays in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ritipiti
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spent 1 lovely week in this hotel. We booked online straight on hotel's site and our credit card was enough. We had the plesant surprise to receive a suite though we wanted a double room. The Ilkay hotel is located very well, 5 min on foot from tram station. The stuff is great, rooms are bright andd clean and the breakfast suites all tastes. The only issue was that we had no wifi in the suite and had to go downstairs in the lobby. Also, the final price was half as the one posted at the reception, so be smart and book online. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis fro the storm”
Reviews.Author: pinkdoo
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel because it has the same name as one of my students. Was not disappointed. Taxi driver took a while to find it but the reception staff were very friendly and helpful The location was great very central. Room small but adequate. would recommend purely for location and staff. breakfast also good

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place and Quality Service”
Reviews.Author: Murali11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Ilkay for 3 nights last week. It was an amazing experience since the hotel is located close to all the major site seeing places. Its central location makes it cost effective for travel since its close to tram stations. The service is out of the box ....staff is English speaking and very polite and courteous. Breakfast is excellent .... Overall ....Hotel Ilkay is A 3 Star hotel with 5 Star Service... Definitely recommend my friends and first timers in Istanbul to stay in this property

Reviews.Title: “nice place nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kozu
Reviews.Content: Ä± have been in november.l like berakfast and room is very clean.Staf is very freandly and profesyonel.when lm come turkey again with family l want stay here again.( thank u very much Fatih,Ugur,Ãœmit for your help)

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: nasibal
Reviews.Content: i was a month a go here in this hotel and is a lovely place. The reception guys, red river personals they are very nice peoples. its the 5. time that i comes to this hotel and i will like to comes every year to this hotel its reallyy reaallyy nice hotel.. peace nasim

Reviews.Title: “Ilkay Hotel not as bad as decribed”
Reviews.Author: yawnoc17
Reviews.Content: To be honest I don't really understand why some people are so unhappy about the hotel. I stayed there with my spouse and our two children. The staff were very friendly and helpful. they would even look after our one-year-old so that we could have breakfast. The breakfast was really nice, a lot of choice. Room service was excellent, very quick and good quality. We would also get hot water for the baby's formula free of charge. In some hotels they charge for it. The room was always cleaned while we were out. We never had any problems there at all. And we are planning a holiday in Istanbul this year and going to stay at Ilkay again.

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: buffalka
Reviews.Content: Well...i booked this hotel directly after i had read many positive reviews about it. Its location is great indeed but the hotel itself and its rooms are worse. Room and inner hotel were old and flake, just the bed was cool. Breakfast was very good and rich though! I have to say that i was feeling disappointed a little about the hotel! I am giving it 4 points just for its unique location and rich breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Istanbul1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ilkay hotel for a week this year. Its my 2nd. visit since 2007. My family and I used to visit the hotel for the following reasons: - very good, professional and friendly personnel, though the rooms have to be renovated. Its my positive critic, since I love this hotel. Fayez Rayes/ Danmark.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: KR304
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ilkay for a week in September 2008 and came back mighty impressed. The thing you can't beat in this hotel is its great location. Most of the sights such as Topkapi palace, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Spice Bazaar and Galata bridge are just about 5-10 minutes walk away. The Grand Bazaar is about 15 minutes by walk. Moreover, the hotel is located in a busy street with the main Istanbul tram line. Therefore there is plenty of traffic, lots of shops and restaurants nearby and general activity even late into the night. About the hotel, other travellers have written about the good ambience, friendly staff and delicious breakfast spread. I agree with all these things. The room and the bathroom were clean and tidy and the towels and linen were changed daily. There was an airconditioner, TV and hair dryer. The only negative point about the room was its very small size. I had booked a single room and there was just enough space for a dresser, a bed and a small wardrobe. The bathroom too was very small. Of course, this mattered little to me because all I needed was a space to sleep in the night. Internet and wireless access were available in the lounge. I would have liked it better if it were available in the rooms too. The hotel staff are quite friendly - they respond to emails. On the day of my leaving, the receptionist even enquired whether my passport and ticket were all OK! All in all, it was a great stay in the hotel. Other than the room size I could not find anything bad about the hotel. Great place to stay unless you are claustrophobic. Again, the location of the hotel is hard to beat, especially if you are a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: SMGLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Having read the very mixed reviews on this site I was not really sure what to expect. It took us ages to find the place, not because it was far from the station but because it was a tiny entrance and looked nothing like it did on the website. We walked past it twice before finally spotting the entrance. The staff were reasonably friendly and answered any questions we had. My gripe with this place was the room. For strarters it was painted an ugly lime green, it looked onto a construction site and the bedding was awful. There was a dirty bed cover on the bed and a tiny sheet underneath it which my husband and I fought over for the five nights we were there. The carpets, curtains and the bed cover were badly in need of replacing and the bathtub was pretty old with paint chipped away. The breakfast was decent with hot and cold food and fruit available but after 5 days of EXACTLY the same things you tire. The location was good and it was easy to get to the major sites as well as the Eminou and Kabatas for the ferries. This is definately a budget hotel and maybe we were wrong in expecting any more. I definately wish I had looked around some more and found a slightly better one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved ILKAY!”
Reviews.Author: tedvard
Reviews.Content: Hello! Our 2 weeks stay in Hotel Ilkay was really great expirience! Nice little hotel in a heart of the old city... just 5 minutes walk from mayor sites (Hagia Sophia, Topkapi palace etc). Nice rooms, excellent breakfast, GREAT stuff - so friendly and helpful, clean and not expensive at all. For one thing I'm sure - I have no doubts where I will stay next time in Istanbul... Ilkay for sure!!! Edward, Belgrade - Sebia :)

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed with Ilkay”
Reviews.Author: Nomad071
Reviews.Content: From the mainly positive reviews on this site I was expecting better - yes, the location is good and the breakfast is a hearty spread, the staff are also helpful - a lot more helpful if you are female I noticed. My main gripe was the room - the walls were cracked, the plaster had come away off most of one wall, the safe was broke, the curtain didnt cover the window although the grill beyond the window was so grimy I couldnt look out anyway - although I think it was just an inner shaft between buildings. Its position by the stairs meant it was also noisy, I had the aircon on constantly, even though it wasnt hot, just to try and drown out some of the ambient noises throughout the night. In their defence, I havent got experience of other hotels in Istanbul to compare it with, maybe I just got unlucky with the room and should have complained at the start. However, I guess the acid test is would I stay again and the answer has to be no. Istanbul itself though is a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SouthPasTripper
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was what won me over at this hotel. They have a very nice buffet for breakfast with a lot of options, including very fresh delicious Turkish bread. The rooms are clean and if you just need a place to rest your head between sightseeing, then I'd recommend the place highly. It's not fancy by any means, but has all the bare bones essentials (plus breakfast!). The staff was very attentive and the location was good. We took the Metro from the airport almost to the doorstep of the hotel (Gulhane stop). All the major attractions are nearby, and you can take the Metro to Istiklal Caddesi where all the best restaurants are.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: MikeCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Booked this thru their website. If you stay more than 3 nights you have free transfer from the airport. The driver was late though, that made me panicked and had to call the hotel. Ilkay Hotel is where the action is. Located on a busy street (where the tram runs) , it is close to the major attractions like topkapi, aya sophia, and is near enough to walk to the pier and Galata bridge. 5 stars to its location. Near to mini supermarkets BIM and DIA. And near to cheap eating places. My recommendation is Urfalim just a few hundred meters down the road. It is a small friendly hotel. part of the lobby is shared with a soap shop and a barber shop. It is amazing that they can squeeze quite a number of rooms into a seemingly small place. It is adequate as a 3 star hotel. My room was clean, has a tiny TV and have ample wardrobe space. Found a friendly and helpful hotel staff called Muharrem who gives good recommendation on food places. Breakfast was adequate. More or less the same food everyday but you cant expect too much for a hotel this size and price. My main complains are the noisy toilets, and its proximity to the main street where you can hear the trams and traffic. While I was there, the hotel was having some minor renovations. Expect a bit of noise if you want to sleep in during the afternoon. But there is so much to see, explore and eat in Istanbul, you shouldnt be in the hotel at day time. Check out the fortune teller with his rabbits just next to the hotel. He comes only at night.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ivana81
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Ilkay for 4 nights and even though the hotel was under some smaller renovation and fully booked , the friendly stuff made as feel like home. They helped us get arround Istanbul and answered all questions with a big smile. We enjoyed drinking tea and relaxing in the lobby after exploring the city. all compliments for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: hajaxx
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife & my infant daughter in a double bedroom at Ilkay Hotel for a week in the first week of August 2008. Simply an amazing place, excellent & helpful staff, good customer-service, good breakfast, clean rooms, spacious (depends on which room U stay). My suggestion is that U insist on staying in Room 209. The staffs are very helpful in helping out with trips in & around Istanbul. All the key tourist attractions are at a stone's throw away - Blue Mosque, Hague Sophia, Islamic Arts Museum, Mosaic Museum, Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, Archeological Musuem, Gulhane Park. Perfect for travelling by Tram, Train or even a Ferry. Will definetly go back. Regards Haja

Reviews.Title: “The Ilkay is a clean value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthOztraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Ilkay 7th-10th April 2008, it is centrally located, reasonably priced and run by helpful staff, we'd be happy to stay again. A clean value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: EbyUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights here in June/July. The rooms were very basic but clean, had air conditioning and a TV. Although the rooms/bathrooms were small, and we only used the room to shower and sleep, it did not matter to us. There is abit of noise outside as theres a cafe right opposite which does not close till late - if you are tired, this will not make a difference! The breakfast was plentiful - fruit, veg, cheese, lots of breads (pastries, croissants, etc..), eggs and is enough to keep you going till lunch. The location was great in between Gulhane Station and Sirkeci - Gulhane station is slightly closer :). All the major attractions can be walked to within 5-10 minutes eg Topkapi Palace, Gulhane Park, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and then to the Eminonu docks in the other direction. At the time of our visit, it was a little scary to see the front reception area being refurbished - we had gone out in the morning to arrive in the evening to find a bomb site - i thought are we in the right place? Overall, it was great value for money and could easily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved to stay”
Reviews.Author: familymd
Reviews.Content: Ilkay hotel is located in the heart of tourist zone of Istanbul, Turkey.Clean air-conditioned rooms,comfortable beds , breakfasts with a lot of local fruit and vegetables - all for the pretty reasonable price, makes this hotel very pleasant place to stay. The last,but not the least, the personnel in the hotel,specifically manager Mr. Umit Meral, create very nice friendly atmosphere and it is very helpful if you first time in the city. Thanks. Mr . & Mrs. Shkolnik Pittsburgh USA

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you are not claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: Ilovecastles
Reviews.Content: This is in a great location within 5 mins walk of Aya Sophia and the Topkapi Palace. Although the rooms/bathrooms are very small and basic in terms of storage space, the beds were clean and comfortable, the staff were very polite, patient and helpful - Serkeci is a buzzy friendly area and the hotel is just around the corner from Eminonu for the Ferry and the Galata bridge over to the New town. Lovely buffet breakfast with good range -including turkish delight! My only complaint- one of the staff persuaded our group leader not to go to a certain restaurant which several of us were keen to go to in New Istanbul but to get a coach instead to a completely different restaurant - which we were not told the name of in advance- which turned out to be very expensive (I'm talking Â£50 a head here), no atmosphere, and not in the location we wanted to be in. I left with others from our party and went to our original choice instead. Im not sure whether this was based on how much they thought our party could afford or what we would enjoy more. So- do your research first.

Reviews.Title: “Ilkay Hotel, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: freeorsino
Reviews.Content: Hi!! I've just have returned from Istambul, Turkey. What a travel!! The city, excellent and their people so friendly!! The hotel, Ilkay Hotel was in the old part of the city and so close to Agias Sophia and Blue Mosque!! The buffet was good (I just tried the breakfast, hhaha) and the room clean and tidy. But the best, by far, was the staff. So kind and helpful that a few hours later I felt home!! Thank you UgÃ¼r for helping us with interesting places to visit and lovely scenary views I could never imagine. If you want to stay in a nice place close to the most interesting monuments of the city, this hotel would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “practical for a week-end”
Reviews.Author: Italian-mony
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few days ago, just for a 3 night & 4 day week end. I must say that it's well located and practical, especially if you don't want to spend a fortune for a short break. Of course I would not have chosen it for more than 3 nights even though rooms and bathrooms are clean and confortable. Overall the hotel is ok, with basic and simple facilities and a pretty good buffet breakfast. The only thing I found terrible was the window curtain in the room as it was impossible to shut it completely to make the room dark. If I hadn't had my sleeping mask it would have been impossible to sleep because of the excessive light coming from outside. The best thing about this hotel is that, in a country where smoking is allowed everywhere, they are offering a restaurant where you can have breakfast in a smoking free environment.

Reviews.Title: “Super wunderfull”
Reviews.Author: halilibo
Reviews.Content: i stay it for 8 nights 1 month a go its a veryy beutifull place.. and the personals of there are very nice.. its verry nice place sirkeci i go 1 april one more time to ilkay hotel its veryy super hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great location at great rates”
Reviews.Author: LondonBookworm
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from an amazing first visit to Istanbul. I booked via Expedia and stayed for seven nights in Hotel Ilkay. Although I was travelling alone, I was automatically allocated a double room. Based on the reviews on internet I requested for a quiet room and received a double room at the back of the hotel and was not disturbed by the busy tram line running in front of the hotel. Hotel Ilkay is a budget hotel with very basic amenities. As a negative point I would say that as most guests seemed to be budget travellers, they tended to come and go at odd hours. I kept on being waking up by noices from corridors and neighbouring rooms by other guests. However, on a positive note I would recommend the hotel for a great location as it is in walking distance from bazaars, several good hammams, Galata Bridge, Bosphorus ferries and Sultanahmet sights such as Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Yerebatan Cisterns and Topkapi palace. The staff were very friendly and helpful with any requests. Some of the rooms seemed to be fairly small, but a double room for a single traveller was more than enough in my case. My room was basic, but cleaned throughoutly every day. If you don't mind staying in a budget hotel, I would recommend Hotel Ilkay for a short stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: tayfunderebasi
Reviews.Content: In Istanbul we have a sell-store. I usually have to stay some month in Istanbul. Than I return to Germany and bach to Istanbul again. I was thinging about to rent a flat but than I discover Ilkay Hotel in Istanbul Sirkeci. This is a nice place to stay. There is not much trafic and it is just a stap to bosporus and the golden horn. In this hotel I have a suite and the price lavel is so good, unbelievable. There are a lot of jung people students staying in this Hotel. A goog oppertunity to have new friends.

Reviews.Title: “honey week”
Reviews.Author: ROMTUR
Reviews.Content: It was the 3th time when i was in Istambul because my lover is there. First time when i was there we tryed to find a good hotel We choose an hotel with the location is cetraly situated and near by most important historycal places. In this htel we met professional and friendly staff like Umit and Ugun who tryed to make our honey week very special. We enjoy every morning to breakfast with veriaty of choise and room cleaned every day. i want to thank to all staff for their ospitality and care. This is ILKAY HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “frÄ±endly staff”
Reviews.Author: nafaz
Reviews.Content: Very good customer servÄ±ce from waÄ±ters, receptÄ±onÄ±sts Ä±n partÄ±cular UmÄ±t, Ugur,sugar and tahsÄ±n had a very welcomÄ±ng approach. Breakfast was great because Ä±t had a bÄ±g range of foods to choose from, cleaners were great, they cleaned when you were not around so you were not dÄ±sturbed. Imbat Restaurant was fantastÄ±c Ä±t has a great range of sea food and salads. I would hÄ±ghly recommend Ä±t to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: topgolfer1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a busy street with a tram line infront of the main entrance, if you are staying at the front of the hotel you can hear them especially if you have the window open ,the room we stayed in was very basic ,towels were canged daily, the room was very noisey you could hear the people in the next room very clearly as if they were in the same room ,the breakfast was good and , the staff were very friendly and helpfull, if you arrive from sabina gokcen airport you will be looking at around 140 turkish lira around Â£70.00 for the cab to the hotel one way i was very disapointed at this.i was very dissapointed with istanbull as every shop or resturant you were hasseled by people trying to get you in to every shop or resturant even when walking in the park someone would come up to you and say hello if you replied they would give you the hard sale saying they have a shop near by please come and have a look , overall i personally do not recomend this as a very relaxing place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BashMax
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Istanbul in Nov 2007 and had a wonderful and pleasant stay at the IIkay Hotel. The Hotel is well located within walking distance to all the historical sites and also benefits from good public transport. The main tramline runs directly outside the hotel. The staff were all very polite and helpful. Almost every member of staff was prepared to go out of their way to help and were very accommodating. The breakfast was very well prepared and presented. We would definately visit and stay at the IIkay hotel again. Bash & Max

Reviews.Title: “Ilkay is great”
Reviews.Author: Saa-Yii
Reviews.Content: This is my sixth time fly to Istanbul . I have seen many hotels , but no one can compare to Ilkay Hotel . This is the second time I stay in Ilkay , because is has the best breakfast and best staff . The food is so delicious , and the people is so friendly . We meet some nice guy here , named : " Fatih seker " , " Umit meral "and " Ugur coban " , they are so nice , they help us so much , I am appriciate . Next time , while I come Istanbul , of course , I will chose Ilkay again !

Reviews.Title: “Happy we stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: Laura1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week, for five days. Booked this particular hotel because we were looking for budget accomodation. Exceeded our expectations! Location is great (only 10 min walk to major sites A. Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi palace, most other must-see things also within walking distance) - and perhaps worth mentioning (especially for us girls) that the hotel is located on a main street so absolutely no need to feel unsafe at night. Breakfast was great, everything you need, and room was fine (clean and good beds) - first day there we woke at 8am because of building noise, we told staff about it and were given another room immediately (great service). Staff at the hotel was very polite and helpful, especially Ugur and Umit at reception who helped make our holiday a fantastic one because they're always up for a chat and a few laughs. So guys, if you're reading this, thanks! :o) Five days in Istanbul is much, much, much too short :o( We've already decided to go back as soon as we can... and will definitely stay at Ilkay again. Laura & Tessa

Reviews.Title: “Met My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: bepag
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Istanbul at 6:00 AM and were boarding a cruise ship that afternoon, so we needed a place to freshen up and store our luggage while we toured Topkapi Palace in the morning. We booked via the Ilkay's website, and everything was arranged and confirmed via email with no difficulties. The hotel is in a good location for touring Sultanahmet. All of the major sites are within walking distance. The rooms were small, but clean and comfortable. The staff was courteous and helpful. The breakfast was good. Overall, this is clean budget hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “In Love With Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MaltaCouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 11 days at Ilkay. We arrived early in the morning and were invited to have a free buffet breakfast. The staff were very helpful; the room was clean and comfortable; breakfast was delicious. Very central, easily reached from airport by metro and tram. Close to buses and ferries in Eminonu and to Orient Express train station. Cheap compared with the rest. We had to leave at 5.00am. missing breakfast but the receptionist brought us a cup of coffee. Very nice of him! He really deserved our tip!! Thanks Ilkay!
